entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued September 08 at 9:49PM AST until September 11 at 8:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM AST SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves of 6 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...Beaches along St Croix Eastern Half. * WHEN...From 6 AM AST Saturday through Monday evening.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 08 at 10:29PM EDT until September 09 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SATURDAY FOR WEST CENTRAL POCAHONTAS, SOUTHWESTERN RANDOLPH AND EAST CENTRAL WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 1029 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL RALEIGH, EASTERN MCDOWELL AND SOUTHERN WYOMING COUNTIES... At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that previous thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 9:34PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAPID RISES ALONG STREAMS IN SOUTH CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTY... Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Oak Hill, and Thurmond.
